intro: Gentianusa campestris, commonly known as the field gentian, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Gentianaceae family. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are upright and branched. Gentianusa campestris plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in temperate regions across Europe and parts of Asia.
